translated: Here the following ten conditions are not found: object condition, prenascence condition, proximity condition, contiguity condition, dependence condition, pre-arising condition, post-arising condition, repetition condition, and absence condition.🔽The rebirth-linking consciousness is a condition in the way already stated for the material instances born of nutriment and the material instances born of temperature.🔽Here too the following conditions are not found: post-arising condition, repetition condition, and absence condition.

original: āhārajarūpa kalāpānañca ekadhā paccayā honti pacchājātavasena. Etthapi pacchājātavacanena
analyzed: ekadhā paccayāḥ honti pacchājāta vasena pacchājāta vacanena
translated: All the mental states are a condition in the way already stated for all the material instances born of consciousness.

original: cattāro pacchājātajātikā gahitā honti, sesā vīsati paccayā na labbhanti.🔽Sabbesu pana tevīsatiyā rūpakalāpesucattāromahā bhūtā aññamaññassa pañcadhā paccayā
analyzed: cattāro pacchājāta jātikāḥ gahitāḥ honti sesāḥ vīsati paccayāḥ na labbhanti  sabbesu pana tevīsatiyā rūpa kalāpesu cattāro mahā bhūtāḥ aññam aññassa pañcadhā paccayā
translated: Here too the following conditions are not found: post-arising condition, repetition condition, and absence condition.🔽The four great primaries are a condition in five ways for the other great primaries in the twenty-three instances of materiality.

original: honti catūhi mahāsaha jātehi ca aññamaññena ca, sahajātānaṃ upādārūpānaṃ catudhā
analyzed: honti catūhi jātehi ca aññamaññena ca sahajātānam upādārūpānam catudhā
translated: They are a condition in four ways for the derived materiality that is conascent with them,

original: paccayā honti catūhi mahāsahajātehi. Āhārarūpaṃ sahajātānañca asahajātānañca sabbesaṃ🔽ajjhattarūpakalāpānaṃ āhāra paccayena paccayo hoti. Navasu kammajarūpakalāpesu jīvitarūpaṃ🔽sahajātānameva rūpānaṃ indriyapaccayena paccayo hoti. Evaṃ ajjhattarūpadhammā ajjhattarūpadhammānaṃ🔽sattadhā paccayā honti. Bahiddhā rūpadhammā pana bahiddhābhūtānaṃ dvinnaṃ utujarūpakalāpānaṃ
analyzed: paccayāḥ honti catūhi mahāsahajātehi āhāra rūpam sahajātānam ca asahajātānam ca sabbesam  ajjhatta rūpa kalāpānaṃ āhāra paccayena paccayaḥ hoti navasu kamma ja rūpa kalāpesu jīvita rūpam  sahajātānam eva rūpānam indriya paccayena paccayaḥ hoti evam ajjhatta rūpa dhammāḥ ajjhatta rūpa dhammānam  sattadhā paccayāḥ honti bahiddhā rūpa dhammāḥ pana bahiddhābhūtānam dvinnam utu ja rūpa kalāpānam
translated: They are conditions for the four primary elements by way of the condition being by conascence condition. Nutriment-born materiality is a condition for the conascence and non-conascence material instances by way of the condition being by nutriment condition. In the nine material instances born of kamma, the materiality of life is a condition for the conascence material instances by way of the condition being by faculty condition. Thus the internal material phenomena are conditions for the internal material phenomena🔽in seven ways. But the external material phenomena are conditions for the external material phenomena by way of the condition being by kamma condition and by way of the condition being by nutriment condition.🔽🔽

original: pañcadhā paccayā hontīti.
analyzed: pañcadhā paccayāḥ honti iti
translated: They are conditions for the four primary elements by way of the four conditions. Nutriment-born materiality is a condition for all the internal material instances, both those born of kamma and those born of nutriment, by way of nutriment condition. Life-continuum materiality is a condition for the material instances associated with it by way of faculty condition. Thus the internal material phenomena are conditions for the internal material phenomena in seven ways. But the external material phenomena are conditions for the external material phenomena in five ways.

original: Rūpakalāpesu paccayaghaṭanānayo niṭṭhito.🔽Ettha ca paṭṭhānasaddassa attho vattabbo. Padhānaṃ ṭhānanti paṭṭhānaṃ. Tattha padhānanti
analyzed: rūpa kalāpesu paccaya ghaṭana anayaḥ niṭṭhito  ettha ca paṭṭhāna saddassa atthaḥ vattabbo padhānam ṭhānan ti paṭṭhānam tattha padhānanti
translated: The method of determining the conditions in the case of the material groups is concluded.

original: pamukhaṃ, ṭhānanti paccayo, pamukhapaccayo mukhyapaccayo ekantapaccayoti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: pamukham ṭhānan ti paccayaḥ pamukha paccayaḥ mukhya paccayaḥ ekanta paccayo ti vuttam hoti
translated: And here the meaning of the word “condition” should be stated. “The foremost, the place, is a determining” , thus it is a condition . Herein, “foremost” means “chief”; “place” means “condition”; thus it is a chief condition, a principal condition, an exclusive condition, is what is meant.

original: So ca ekanta paccayo ekantapaccayuppannaṃ paṭicca vattabbo.
analyzed: saḥ ca ekanta paccayaḥ ekanta paccaya uppannam paṭicca vattabbaḥ
translated: And that exclusive condition should be stated in dependence upon an exclusive condition-born state.

original: Duvidhañhi paccayuppannaṃ mukhyapaccayuppannaṃ nissandapaccayuppannanti. Tattha mukhyapaccayuppannaṃ
analyzed: duvidham hi paccaya uppannam mukhya paccaya uppannam nissanda paccaya uppannam ti tattha mukhya paccaya uppannam
translated: For the condition by way of arising is twofold, as principal condition by way of arising and as resultant condition by way of arising. Herein, the principal condition by way of arising is

original: nāma mūlapaccayuppannaṃ, nissandapaccayuppannaṃ nāma parampara paccayuppannaṃ. Tattha
analyzed: nāma mūla paccaya uppannam nissanda paccaya uppannam nāma parampara paccaya uppannam tattha
translated: the root condition by way of arising. The resultant condition by way of arising is the successive condition by way of arising. Herein,

original: mūlapaccayuppannameva ekantapaccayuppannaṃ nāma. Tañhi attano paccaye sati ekantena
analyzed: mūla paccaya uppannam eva ekantapaccayuppannam nāma tat hi attanaḥ paccaye sati ekantena
translated: the root condition by way of arising is called the sole condition by way of arising. For that arises only when its own condition exists,

original: uppajjatiyeva, no nuppajjati. Paramparapaccayuppannaṃ pana anekantapaccayuppannaṃnāma,
analyzed: uppajjatiyā iva no nuppajjati parampara paccayuppannam pana anekanta paccayuppannam nāma
translated: and it does not arise when it does not exist. But the successive condition by way of arising is called the multiple condition by way of arising.

original: tañhi tasmiṃ paccaye satipi uppajjati vā, na vā uppajjati. Tattha ekantapaccayuppannaṃ
analyzed: tat hi tasmim paccaye sati pi uppajjati vā na vā uppajjati tattha ekanta paccaya uppannam
translated: For that arises when its condition exists, and it does not arise when it does not exist. Herein,

original: paṭicca so paccayo ekantapaccayo nāma. So eva imasmiṃ mahāpakaraṇe vutto. Tato eva
analyzed: paṭicca so paccayaḥ ekantapaccayaḥ nāma saḥ eva imasmim mahā pakaraṇe vuttaḥ tatas eva
translated: the condition by way of the sole condition by way of arising is called the sole condition. That is stated in this Great Book.

original: ayaṃ catuvīsatipaccayagaṇo ca imaṃ mahā pakaraṇañca paṭṭhānanti vuccati.
analyzed: ayam catuvīsati paccaya gaṇo ca imam mahā pakaraṇam ca paṭṭhānan ti vuccati
translated: Therefore this group of twenty-four conditions and this Great Book are called the “bases.”

original: Tattha ekassa purisassa dhanadhaññatthāya lobho uppajjati. So lobhavasena uṭṭhāya
analyzed: tattha ekassa purisassa dhana dhañña tthāya lobhaḥ uppajjati saḥ lobha vasena uṭṭhāya
translated: Herein, for a man who has arisen, greed arises for wealth and corn. He gets up through greed,

original: araññaṃ gantvā ekasmiṃ padese khettāni karoti, vatthūni karoti, uyyānāni karoti.
analyzed: araññam gantvā ekasmin padese khettāni karoti vatthūni karoti uyyānāni karoti
translated: He goes to the forest and makes fields, makes land-sites, and makes gardens.

original: Tesu sampajjamānesu so puriso bahūni dhanadhaññāni labhitvā attanā ca paribhuñjati,
analyzed: tesu sampajjamānesu saḥ purisaḥ bahūni dhana dhaññāni labhitvā attanā ca paribhuñjati
translated: As these are being made, that man gets much wealth and corn. He enjoys it himself,

original: puttadāre ca poseti, puññāni ca karoti, puññaphalāni ca āyatiṃ paccanubhavissati.
analyzed: putta dāre ca poseti puññāni ca karoti puñña phalāni ca āyatim paccanubhavissati
translated: and he supports his wife and children, and he does meritorious deeds, and he will experience the fruits of merit in the future.

original: Tattha lobhasaha jātāni nāmarūpāni mukhyapaccayuppannāni nāma. Tato paraṃ yāva āyatiṃ
analyzed: tattha lobha saha jātāni nāma rūpāni mukhya paccaya uppannāni nāma tato param yāva āyatim
translated: Herein, the mentality-materiality that is conjoined with greed is called “primary result.” What comes next,

original: bhavesu puññaphalāni paccanubhoti, tāva uppannāni paramparaphalāni tassa lobhassa🔽nissandapaccayuppannāni nāma. Tesu dvīsu paccayuppannesu mukhyapaccayuppannameva
analyzed: bhavesu puñña phalāni paccanubhoti tāva uppannāni parampara phalāni tassa lobhassa  nissanda paccaya uppannāni nāma tesu dvīsu paccaya uppannesu mukhya paccaya uppannam eva
translated: as far as the experiencing of the fruits of merit in future lives, is called “secondary result” of that greed.

original: paṭṭhāne vuttaṃ. Nissandapaccayuppannaṃ pana suttantanayena kathetabbaṃ. Tattha suttantanayo
analyzed: paṭṭhāne vuttam nissanda paccaya uppannam pana suttanta nayena kathetabbam tattha suttanta nayo
translated: Of these two kinds of result, only the primary result is mentioned in the Paṭṭhāna. But the secondary result should be explained according to the Suttas. Herein, the method of the Suttas

original: nāma imasmiṃ sati idaṃ hoti, imassa uppādā idaṃ uppajjatīti evarūpo paccayanayo.
analyzed: nāma imasmin sati idam hoti imassa uppādā idam uppajjati iti evarūpaḥ paccaya nayo
translated: is the method of condition, which is of the form “When this exists, that comes to be; from the arising of this, that arises.”

original: Api ca lobho doso mohoti tayo dhammā sakalassa sattalokassapi saṅkhāralokassapi okāsa🔽lokassapi vipattiyā mūlaṭṭhena hetū nāma. Alobho adoso amohoti tayo dhammā sampattiyā
analyzed: api ca lobhaḥ dosaḥ mohaḥ ti tayo dhammā sakalassa satta lokassa api saṅkhāra lokassa api okāsa  lokassa api vipattiyā mūla ṭṭhena hetū nāma alobhaḥ adosaḥ amohaḥ ti tayo dhammā sampattiyā
translated: Moreover, the three states of greed, hate, and delusion are the roots in the sense of being the cause of the calamity that befalls the whole world of beings and the whole world of formations and the whole world of location. The three states of non-greed, non-hate, and non-delusion are the roots in the sense of being the cause of the prosperity that befalls them.

original: mūlaṭṭhena hetūnāmāti kathetabbaṃ. Esa nayo sabbesu paṭṭhānapaccayesu yathārahaṃ🔽veditabbo. Evañca sati loke sabbā lokappavattiyo imesaṃ catuvīsatiyā paccayānaṃ mukhya
analyzed: mūla ṭṭhena hetūnam ati kathetabbam esa nayo sabbesu paṭṭhāna paccayesu yathāraham  veditabbaḥ evam ca sati loke sabbāḥ loka ppavattiyaḥ imesam catuvīsatiyā paccayānam
translated: And moreover, the three states of greed, hate, and delusion are the roots in the sense of cause for the misfortune of the whole world of beings and the world of formations and the world of location. The three states of non-greed, non-hate, and non-delusion are the roots in the sense of cause for the good fortune of the whole world of beings and the world of formations and the world of location. This should be told. And so too in the case of all the other conditions.

original: paccayuppannena saddhiṃ nissandapaccayuppannā eva hontīti veditabboti.
analyzed: paccaya uppannena saddhim nissanda paccaya uppannāḥ eva honti iti veditabbā uti
translated: And when that is so, it should be understood that all the occurrences of the world in the world are only the result of the primary resultants of these twenty-four conditions together with the secondary resultants.

original: Ettāvatā paccayānaṃ atthadīpanā paccayānaṃ sabhāgasaṅgaho paccayānaṃ ghaṭanānayoti tīhi kaṇḍehi paricchinnā paṭṭhānuddesa dīpanī niṭṭhitā hoti.
analyzed: ettāvatā paccayānam attha dīpanā paccayānam sa bhāga saṅgaho paccayānam ghaṭanā anayo ti tīhi kaṇḍehi paricchinnā paṭṭhāna uddesa dīpanī niṭṭhitā hoti
translated: At this point the exposition of the meaning of the conditions, the inclusion of the conditions by their general characteristics, and the coordination of the conditions, which are dealt with in the three sections, is completed in the exposition of the Description of the Conditions.

original: Mrammaraṭṭhe mौṃjvānagare leḍītīaraññavihāravāsinā mahā therena katāyaṃ paccayuddesadīpanī.
analyzed: mrammaraṭṭhe mṃjvā nagare leḍītīarañña vihāra vāsinā mahā therena katā ayam paccaya uddesa dīpanī
translated: This exposition of the Description of the Conditions was composed by the Elder who lived in the Leḍḍu Cave in the Mrammara country in the Mrammara town.
